Daily Mail 同泰晤士報已經屌緊啲鬼佬白衫

Shocking moment British ex-pat police chief orders tear gas to be blasted at politician protester during Hong Kong riots

It comes as two more British ex-pat police officers have been accused of leading a tough crackdown during the Hong Kong protests.

Chief Superintendents David Jordan and Rupert Dover were two of the most senior officers in charge of crowd control during the ugly riots.

The ex-pat officer added: 'Dover and Jordan have been vilified because of what happened 5 years ago. They are aware of the negative social media but their attitude is ‘f*** it, we will carry on doing our job.’

'As police we have a job to do. These two guys have a track record of sorting things out.'

https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-7168131/Shocking-moment-British-ex-pat-police-chief-orders-tear-gas-blasted-politician-protester.html

Activists single out British officers in protests against Hong Kong police

Two senior British officers in the Hong Kong police force have become targets of angry protests for their roles as commanders during violent clashes over the territory’s now-shelved extradition bill.

During a blockade of police headquarters that ended early yesterday, some protesters carried pictures of the officers, Rupert Dover and David Jordan, with the message “Shame on HKPF”. In earlier protests “blood debt” was written in Chinese next to the pictures of the two Britons, both chief superintendents.

https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/hong-kong-protesters-turn-ire-on-british-officers-after-clashes-with-police-over-china-extradition-bill-frg8b3hg3
(要subscribe 先可以睇全文)
